cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northward then turning northeast along the Texas coast toward the upper Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast near Matagorda Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: East of High Island, TX to Sabine Pass
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to High Island, TX
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast from Port Aransas through Sabine Pass and portions of southwestern Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (sustained 39–57 mph, gusts higher) possible Tuesday, peaking midday–evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible in Sabine Lake and adjacent bays
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches of rain with locally higher totals; flash and urban flooding likely
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents, possible short-term port access channel closures due to high water
